thread.title: George W. Bush Announces He’s Attending Trump’s Inauguration
thread.title_full: George W. Bush Announces He’s Attending Trump’s Inauguration

author: Ben Marquis
title: George W. Bush Announces He’s Attending Trump’s Inauguration
text:
Bill Attacks Trump But Looks Like a Fool When He Forgets “It’s the Economy, Stupid” 
While not wholly unexpected and certainly not unwelcome, the attendance of Bush at Trump’s inauguration has nevertheless surprised some people, given the “complicated” nature of the relationship between Bush and Trump. 
To be sure, Bush fully supported his younger brother Jeb in the Republican primary, essentially sat out the 2016 general election and didn’t offer support to Trump’s campaign, and even admitted to not casting a vote for president at all on Election Day, instead focusing solely on voting for the rest of the GOP elsewhere on his ballot. 
Nevertheless he did call Trump after his electoral victory to congratulate him and has issued words of support since.   
Bush will not be joined at the inauguration by his father, former President George H.W. Bush, whose advanced age and declining health will reportedly prevent his attendance, according to Politico . 
It is expected that President Barack Obama will attend at least part of the inauguration ceremony, as tradition dictates a sort of handing-off of power from the current president to his incoming replacement. 
However, it remained unclear at this time whether former President Bill Clinton would attend the ceremony, given the bitter general election campaign waged between Trump and Clinton’s wife, Democrat nominee Hillary Clinton. 
Please share this on Facebook and Twitter to help spread the word that former President George W. Bush will be in attendance at the inauguration of Donald Trump.
